definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: The donee must take delivery and accept the transfer of ownership.
sentences.chinese: 受赠人应受领交付并接收所有权的转移。

sentences.english: The legal liability of delay of acceptance is rather weak. Acceptance is a kind of nonstandard duty.
sentences.chinese: 受领迟延的法定责任较弱，因其是一种不真正义务。

sentences.english: There are many disputes about whether acceptance is right or duty for the creditor.
sentences.chinese: 受领是债权人的权利还是义务，向有争议。

sentences.english: The buyer must take delivery of the goods when A4 and A7 have been complied with.
sentences.chinese: 买方必须在卖方按照A4和A7规定交货时受领货物。

sentences.english: The buyer must provide the seller with appropriate evidence of having taken delivery.
sentences.chinese: 买方必须向卖方提供已受领货物的适当凭证。

sentences.english: The buyer must take delivery of the goods when they have been delivered as envisaged in A4.
sentences.chinese: 买方必须在卖方按照A4规定交货时，受领货物。

definition: to recognize sth after the event/posthumous recognition/to ratify/to endorse retroactively
to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
